summary.p: The Kantapurāṇacurukkam is an epitome (curukkam) of the Kantapurāṇam, in verse, by Campantacaraṇālayacuvāmi. From Raghavan (1960, p. 232), we learn that Campantacaraṇālayacuvāmi was a scholar in Tamil, Telugu and Kannada, attached to the Dharmapuram Mutt, and that he wrote this epitome (in 1049 stanzas) at the instance of the Mysore Ruler.

The copying of the manuscript was a collective work as indicated by the different recognizable hands and the variety of the foliations. There are also blank but foliated folios, one interesting and enigmatic case being U2, f77 (blank except for piḷḷaiyār cuḻi and foliation), whereas there is no text discontinuity between between f76v (first part of stanza no. 27) and f78r (second part of stanza no. 28). Furthermore, there are in-text chapter completion statements not matching the marginal chapter headers in the preceding folios.
The text is incomplete. A third of the Yuttakāṇṭam, the whole of the Tēvakāṇṭam, and almost half of the Takṣakāṇṭam are missing.

Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, invocation page, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, marginal sub-chapter headers [the Yuttakāṇṭam is subdivided in sections, each with an independent numbering of the stanzas], in-text chapter completion statement, in-text total stanzas, addendum (U2, f[1]v).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: GOML D. 546, D. 5479 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 526ff.).

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank. Shelfmark. Hand #1.
107 folios = Kantapurāṇacurukkam: Text. Tamil foliation 1– 107. By several hands, different from hand # 1. 7 to 10 lines per page.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation. Some bore holes caused by insects.

additions.desc: BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 336 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to 1840 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds. Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequested in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
